posts.post_content:
Posted By: Chris
Two Cabinet Cards for Sale. Authentic cards being sold from the Oshkosh area.

One of the cards is similar to the one shown at this link: <a href="http://www.robertedwardauctions.com/auction/2006/29.html" target="_new" rel="nofollow">[url]http://www.robertedwardauctions.com/auction/2006/29.html</a[/url]>

The second card is similar to this link:
[url]http://tinyurl.com/46y4d5[/url]

Serious Inquiries and offers only, before they head to auction. Pictures available upon request. I do not use Photobucket, but if you tell me how to add the pictures I will gladly include them in the post.

Posted By: leon
If you send me the scans I will post them for you. Good luck....

Posted By: Dan Bretta
How strange to see this post...today I was researching the 1886 Western League Lincoln team and midway through the season the Oshkosh manager W.R. Harrington replaced Lincoln's manager and along with him came 5 players that were on the Oshkosh roster.  Apparently Oshkosh really benefited from this move as that 1887 team looked pretty formidable.

Posted By: leon
Chris sent me the scans and I had to reduce them quite a bit to fit. Both cards definitely look legit....(the other back is blank so I didn't post it)...Remember these are resized so exact dimensions need to be obtained from the seller....They are NOT in proportion to each other, size-wise....I think they might both be similar in size?

[IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1221230504.JPG[/IMG] 
[IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1221230886.JPG[/IMG] 
[IMG]http://www.network54.com/Realm/tmp/1221230901.JPG[/IMG]

Posted By: barrysloate
These are really great! Good luck with the sale.

Posted By: Dan Bretta
Wow!  Those are great....interesting to me that half of the 1886 Oshkosh team ended up in Lincoln before the end of the season and nearly half of the 1887 Oshkosh team ended up in Omaha in 1888.

Posted By: Scott
Hi Chris,

I'm very interested in one or both of these.  Please e-mail me at scottg@accessmfgsys.com so we can exchange phone #'s.

Thank you,

Scott.

Posted By: Matthew S. Moore
It'd be good to have those for the "Dummy" Hoy biography. But I'm too late, and will therefore have to settle for scans. Whoever buys 'em, do let me know!

Posted By: Chris
The two cards are still available.  The seller has set a final price of $10,200 for the pair, payment via wire transfer.

Please let me know if you are interested.  If the cards do not sell on the forum, they will be available at the next REA.

Thanks,
Chris
